## Helper.isNumber() function

Checks if value is classified as a Number primitive or object.

Note: To exclude Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN, which are classified as numbers, use the \_.isFinite method.

**Signature:**

```typescript
isNumber: (value?: any) => value is number
```

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

value


</td><td>

any


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The value to check.  Returns true if value is correctly classified, else false.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

value is number
